name.value: FHIR Connectathon AU December 2017 - Provider Directory - Scenario 1 - PractitionerRole Search - XML

description.value: PractitionerRole search capabilities tests; resource format XML; test a FHIR server's PractitionerRole search operation support using the parameters: identifier, practitioner.name, practitioner.family, practitioner.given. Default values for the search parameters are based on the Practitioner Resource Example and can be modified to allow testing against other known PractitionerRole and Practitioner resource instances.
PractitionerRole read and search operations
Search PractitionerRole using the practitioner.name search parameter with the provided name.family data value. Include the referenced Organization, EndPoint and Location resources.
Search for PractitionerRole matches using the practitioner.name search.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/xml+fhir'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there is at least one record returned. Although not expected, there could be other PractitionerRole records returned.
Read the first PractitionerRole found in the practitioner.name search and verify the contents.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/xml+fhir'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is PractitionerRole.
Confirm that the returned PractitionerRole conforms to the base FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
Confirm that the returned PractitionerRole conforms to the HL7 AU Base IG FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
Confirm that the returned PractitionerRole conforms to the HL7 AU Provider Directory IG FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.

Confirm that the returned PractitionerRole conforms to the HL7 AU Provider Directory IG FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
